body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, lawyer. Kentucky native. Attended at Center College. Graduated from the College of New Jersey at Princeton, New Jersey. Attended Transylvania School of Law. Practiced law in Danville, Kentucky. Married to Elizabeth Owsley Anderson Boyle. Father of W. O. Boyle, John H. J. Boyle, Clayton J. Boyle, Henry B. Boyle, Amelia Boyle, and J. Tilford Boyle, Jr. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in 1860. Brigadier general of volunteers from November 1861 to January 1864. Preisdent of the Louisville City Railway Company in 1865.
